page.title: 06Natural History, The Lee p.2
page.content: {Fauna}Those particular to this area are the Muntjac Deer & the Glis-Glis, both escapees from Woburn, which flourish in the wild. Badgers are widespread & there are also Roe Deer. Grey squirrels are a common menace, damaging (even killing) young trees. {Insects}There are several types of bumble bee & also butterflies especially Peacocks & Chalk Blues. {Birds}Resident species include robin, magpie, dunnock, tit family, sparrows, the thrushes, starling, blackbird, the finches, wren, nuthatch, tree creeper, greater & lesser spotted woodpeckers & kestrel. Winter visitors include redwing, fieldfare & blackheaded gull. Summer visitors include the warblers, swallows, swifts, housemartins, flycatchers & cuckoos. Flocks of rooks & jackdaws (about 5,000) alight in Bray's Wood in 15 mins. in the winter.
